titleStmt.title: Will S. Pryor et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11130

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: The undersigned state that Reuben Hudson became the surety of ^with^ one David C Hull on a Bond conditioned for the apperance of William Hull, to answer an indictment for Felony vs him (Hull) in the Mason Circuit Court= The Bond was forfeited, and failing to make his appearance Hull is now a convict in the Penitentiary of this state. Reuben Hudson the security is a citizen of Henry County Ky and is an excellent young citizen has but little property and to pay the amt of the Bond would result in the sale & sacrifice of his property -- an execution is now in the hands of the= Sheriff of Henry County for the amt viz $300 in favor of the Comwth of Ky with interest from 24th July 1861 & returnable 1st March 1862 said execution is (Fifty No 2) we hope the Judgment may be remitted -- yours 24t Feby 1862

Tho Rodman
W E Berryman
Robt B Gray
Joseph Thomasson
David Fitzgerald
N, Smith
Will S. Pryor
Geo C. Drane
J W Brannin
P W Bannan
Jno. C. Monfort P J H C C
John N. Oliver
P. Thomas Clk H C C
Thomas. Brown
William Smith
C. T. Chilton
J. P. Ellis
Wm A Perry
J. N. Caplinger
Robert Cooper
Berry Ellis
Levin E. Goslel
J Calentine
W. P. Smith
M Murphey
S M Bruce
E, D, Robertson
W W Brown
Preston Slark
B. F. Cogle
D. L. Scott
John Roberts
E. H. Suddeth
I had a letter in my possession from R. H. Stanton Comm Atty. in which he expressed a desire that the fine Should & also expressed the the opinion that it would be remitted. save an Attys fee & costs
L D Owen S. H. C.
